title.narrative: STRENGHTENED DISTRICT CAPACITY FOR WASHSERVICE DELIVERY

description.narrative: Four district development authorities have strengthened capacity to deliver equitable, adequate, sustainable WASH services at households, schools and health facilities, including during emergencies, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Operations Support To Programme Delivery, Sanitation, Supply And Logistics, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: New Element

sector.narrative: Sanitation - improving services in rural communities (except household water treatment and storage, moving up the ladder and strengthening sustainability)
Sanitation and hygiene - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) including menstrual hygiene management
WASH - Enabling environment (policies/strategies, coordination, regulation, financing, planning-monitoring-review, sector capacity development and professionalization)
WASH - risk informed programming including climate resilience disaster and conflict
Water sector policy and administrative management
Water supply and sanitation - large systems

UNICEF Programmes in Papau New Guinea (WASH)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Four district development authorities have strengthened capacity to deliver equitable, adequate, sustainable WASH services at households, schools and health facilities, including during emergencies

description.narrative: WASH services improvements initiated in four focus districts through partnership with three international CSOs. 20,883 students, including 9,097 girls, have benefitted from the WASH services provided in 67 schools. Construction is under progress in 24 more schools, which will benefit 4,243 additional children. Community mobilization capacity of the project districts was strengthened through training of 435 social mobilisers on Community Led Total Sanitation. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:17/01/2020

actual.value: 2019:Four UNICEF focus District Development Authorities are coordinating WASH service delivery in their districts

title.narrative: Four capacitated District Development Authorities implementing adequately financed five year WaSH action plans
